kdl.prox.model2.common.probdistributions
Class ContinuousProbDistribution

java.lang.Object
  kdl.prox.model2.common.probdistributions.ProbDistribution
      kdl.prox.model2.common.probdistributions.ContinuousProbDistribution
Direct Known Subclasses:
ContinuousEpanechnikovProbDistribution
public class ContinuousProbDistribution
extends ProbDistribution

A continuous distribution assumes that the values come from a continuous domain, and uses a Guassian density function to estimate the probability of a given value

gaussianPdf

public double gaussianPdf(double x,
                          double mean,
                          double sdev)
Returns the value (modulo delta) of a normal or gaussian probability density function for x.

gaussianPdf(x, mean, s) = 1/(s*sqrt(2*pi)) * e^(-((x-mean)^2)/(2s^2))

Parameters:
x - the value for which you want a probability estimate
mean - the mean of the gaussian distribution
sdev - the standard deviation of the gaussian distribution

getSmoothedProbability

public double getSmoothedProbability(java.lang.Object value)
Smoothes the probability

todo find a better way to do this Beta code: the method below is ad hoc. Use 0.01/N as the deafult prob where N=number of examples in this distribution. (Used to use 1/N where N=total # examples but is too inefficent to poll all distributions in conditional estimator). It prevents conditional probabilities of zero, but there are probably better ways. (Emailed George John on 3/8/98.)

Specified by:
getSmoothedProbability in class ProbDistribution
Parameters:
value - the value of the observation
